title: Portfolio
description: A portfolio to showcase some stuff. It's currently a work in progress, since I need to revise structures of my webpage to allow for a portfolio style document.

sections.content:
I'm adding this warning here, since I might link this page directly. There are some issues with the webpage you might encounter. They are listed below..
- Mobile devices window increasing when changing pages
- Poor page transitions (disabled for big screens)
- Poor line spacing
- General poor sizing and word wrap for small monitors
- Note to myself: Add navigation headers that don't render a title
BS in Computer Science and Mathematics

_University of Washington Bothell, WA, 2018-2022_
- Annual Dean's List 2018-2021
- GPA: 3.67

Note: I don't normally pick up phone calls unless someone messages me first through email. The reason for that is because I don't know who's a spam caller or not. I don't know why, but I've even recieved phone calls from people speaking only Chinese asking why I'm not at work. I don't speak Chinese, and I've never worked at a restaurant.

A list of courses I've taken.
- Intro to Game Development - made C# network FPS game
- Parallel Distributed Computing - Java with threading and Linux machines
- Abstract Algebra I & II - painful math proofs
- Physics - Electromagnetic and Oscillation Motions
- Numerical Analysis I & II - general error anaylysis, regressions, and approximations using floating point data
- Financial Mathematics - Loans, interest, and bond calculations
- Physics - Mechanics
- Multivariable Calculus
- Computer Science Capstone - ORM Web tool
- Real Analysis
- Discrete Mathematics - Mostly just graph algorithms (e.g. Dijkstra's, Markov Chains, Prim's Algorithm, etc...)
- Statistical Inference - Not sure, but used R to simplify the calculations
- Advanced Linear Algebra - Linear algebra but with proofs
- Intro to Diffierential Equations
- Database Systems - relational database design and creationg in MySQL
- Machine Intelligence - Mostly explored audio pre-processing and training. Was mostly unsuccessful.
- 3D Computer Graphics - Basic 3D Unity stuff
- Hardware and Computer Organization - writing assembly code
- Operating Systems - processes or something
- Undergraduate Research (Spatial Analysis of people before and after covid through Geolocation data) - worked on collecting social media data
- Foundations to Modern Math - math proofs
- Data, Algorithms, and Math I & II - C++ programming
- Analysis and Design - Software architecture/patterns
- Signal Computing - pain
- Management Principles
- K12 Computing Education - taught kids at middle school
- Calculus III
- Intro to Drawing
- Matrix Algebra - linear algebra, but dumber
- Intro to Buisness Statistics - statistics, but using excel
- Intro to Cybersecurity - no, don't download viruses on your pc
- Computer Programming II - Java
- Visual Literary Performing Arts I & II - writing
- AP CS A
- AP US History
- AP World History
- AP Math AB
Samples of my work. TODO: dig up old projects.

I am a graduate from the University of Washington Bothell with a bachelor of science in computer science and mathematics looking to apply my skills and passion for programming in an entry-level position. I spent the last five years programming since high school, and I've learned to pick up countless programming languages and apply myself to varying projects. I'm a little slow at times, but I'm capable of exploring and learning things on my own with minimal oversight.

Aside from job hunting (which I'm struggling quite a bit in), I've been applying myself into real time rendering and full stack webpage design. This is all for my end goal of making a video game from near scratch

In about 5 or 10 years from now, I at least hope that I'll continue to work on projects that interest me. Making cool webpages, developing databases, or maybe even just hashing out features that I think would be cool and funny to add.
